title: Personal email account of Czech PM's hacked
title_page: Personal email account of Czech PM's hacked | Daily Mail Online
text:
Personal email account of Czech PM's hacked
PRAGUE (AP) — Czech Prime Minister Bohuslav Sobotka says experts are taking steps to increase security of communications of government members after hackers breached his personal email account.
Monday's announcement comes after a group of unknown hackers linked to a neo-Nazi and strongly anti-migrant Web site "White Media" published in recent days what they claimed were Sobotka's personal emails. Previously, they also hacked his Twitter account.
Dozens of emails published by the hackers mostly deal with the migrant crisis and the government's response to it.
Acknowledging for the first time that his account was hacked, Sobotka said: "I have become one of many victims of the hackers."
Police are investigating.
